children.value: The doubly linked list allows the list to be traversed in both directions; forwards and backwards
is a type of linked list in which each node contains three parts:
: The value stored in the node.
: A reference to the next node in the list.
: A reference to the previous node in the list.
In a doubly linked list, each node is connected to both its next and previous nodes, creating a two-way linkage.
The first node (head) has its previous pointer set to
, and the last node (tail) has its next pointer set to
Benefits of a Doubly Linked List:

children.label: Benefits of a Doubly Linked List:

children.value: : You can easily traverse the list in both forward and backward directions.
: Insertion and deletion of nodes can be more efficient since you can easily access the previous node.
